rev.comment: replaced definition with more common one, and removed superfluous sentence.
/* Conceptions of an anarchist society */ Last version was ungrammatical
Rv to last version by myself, 2nd rv for today, reasons already listed. The definition supplied is even referance in the very definition RJ insists on using, and is from his prefered dictionary
revert to previous RJII. Merriam-Webster dictionary is widely regarded as being an authority on how people typically use a word.
{{Revert}} to the previous edit by [[User:RJII]], since if dictionary disagrees with the way [[peopleppl use the [[word]] it's [[dictionary]] that's incorrect
the world's most respected and popular dictionary, Merriam-Webster defines anarchism as "http://www.m-w.com/cgi-bin/dictionary?book=Dictionary&va=anarchism ..so no more B.S
reverted to version 05:15, 8 Mar 2005 - Kevehs gratuitously deleted information based on dictionary definition of "anarchist" rather than "anarchism"
Rv to last v by myself. Its already been explained why a simple dictionary definition cannot define a political movement, and the changes to the AC section are merely a rv that talk page addresses
inserting link to common definition of anarchism
the world's most respected and popular dictionary, Merriam-Webster defines anarchism as "http://www.m-w.com/cgi-bin/dictionary?book=Dictionary&va=anarchism ..so no more B.S.

/* Anarchism and anarcho-capitalism */ anarchist movement that opposes capitalism
/* Anarchism and anarcho-capitalism */ a few internet sites don't erase a movement
anti-capitalism is one of the tenets of anarchism
/* Anarchism and anarcho-capitalism */ "Anarchism as defined by anarchists" is circular, tautological, and self-serving... you need *some* clarifying adjective.
/* Anarchism and anarcho-capitalism */ revert, that doesn't clarify, it obscures
/* Anarchism and anarcho-capitalism */ this has been discussed before
/* Anarchist economic organization */ changed resourses to resources to correct spelling
/* Anarchist economic organization */ anarcho-primitivists had two brackets before it - presumably supposed to be a hyper-link but isn't linked. also took out extra commas before parentheses.
/* Anarchist economic organization */ took out 2 unnecessary commas and added a missing final parentheses in aid (much like the modern free software movement)
Revert, to thwart yet another attempt to remove balance from the links
/* Anarchist social organization */ Changed "which although is hierarchaly organized with a boss" to "which despite being hierarchically organized with a boss" to correct grammar & spelling
/* Anarchist social organization */ Changed "Social services, (teachers and doctors)" to "Social services (such as teaching and medicine)" for grammatical correctness
/* Post-left anarchy */ - Changed "post-leftists argues" in the first sentence of the 3rd paragraph to "post-leftists argue" to fix the grammar.
/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ anarcho-capitalism article is not about definition of anarchism
/* Insurrectionary Anarchism */ - changed "it's" to "its" (because it is the possessive, not the contraction), and "on its praxis" to "of its praxis" because it seemed more gramatically correct.
If anarcho-capitalists insist on inflating every darn version of this passage there is nothing to do but go with a minimalist approach

anti-nuclear->animal rights (the arbitrary examples might as be things we have an article on)

moved A-C section up to conflicts within anarchism section, expanded a little.
Well obviously anarcho-capitalists consider themselves to be anarchists

/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ Tweaked capitalization, punctuation
sorry, last edit wasn't minor. fixing wikilink
why are we bending definitions here? if ac is not verified by anyone but acs, then why should their definiton be ours?

/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ Anarcho-capitalist claims to belong to the anarchist tradition are [[controversial]].
/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ this passage is redundant to the article on AC, and just raises issues which this community is evidently unwilling to fairly address here
/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ in any case it's an ambiguous sentence
/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ It's not Marxists that simply use this definition
Again, this passage is redundant to the ac article and only serves to add fluff to the section, all of this belong in the criticism of ac section on that page
/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ this time preserve unrelated changes
Their views are stated, this is the most balanced way to address this issue
/* Anarchism and Anarcho-Capitalism */ Once again trying to make description more balanced

added type of society wanted to intro
i like it ..clearly distinguished from paleoanarchists

Alphabetized again, keeping all other changes current.
Getting some of the other changes back into this version
rv to Silverback, if the other edits are significant get them in both versions, the other anarchisms are only of historical significance, anarcho-capitalism is the one that is alive today,
Rv to Max, unrelated but valid edits were undone in last revert. Furthermore, speculation that acs are a "significant" part of the libertarianism movement does not indicate real numbers or influence
rv to Silverback, anarcho capitalism is the most socially active anarchism, since they are significant component of the libertarian movement, although at some point the two will have to depart
added to sentance noting ac's concept of property and democracy
Revert; the old version was better

rv to rjII, but incorporating the generally correction. With gratuitious reorganization it is difficult to tell via compare whether there have been edits

rv to RJII. Sentence saying list was in alphabetical order was cut, then anarcho-cap put at bottom because it was "unimportant", and anarcha-feminism left at top of list.

cut out unjustified spotlight on minor issue, and reordered it
Rv to last version by Dtobias. I agree completely that -equal- wording is not called for, anarcho-capitalism is a minor and controversial sub-movement that does not merit equal space, much less MORE
rv to Silverback, I don't think equal column inches is required for NPOV, with the fringe anarchisms. equality vs non-coercion is the main divide
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ Minor rewording; old one was punctuated ungrammatically
Misplaced emphasis, already discussed on anarcho-capitalism page, the text now spends more time on anarcho-capitalism in this section than primitivism, anarcho-feminism, or even anarcho-communism
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ it is equality that requires coercion, and is of questionable desirability
/* Precursors of anarchism */ made capialism a link
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ starting to think anarcho-capitalism shouldn't be in here at all....
Anarcho-capitalism doesn't advocate economic change - it is the odd one out !!!!
this is the only thing all the types of anarchism have in common
revert, anarchism advocates the elimination of hierarchy, doesn't just "challenge its legitimacy"
making NPOV. not everyone agrees that what they may refer to as hiearchy is actually such, and that what they refer to as imposed authority is actually such
Morality never enters the equation, and the previous wording made more sense
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ exchanges are the mechanism, where people are free to exchange, markets occur
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ a little more on the definition
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ Nitpick: period should go inside parens because entire sentence is there
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ dropped voluntary, exchanges is a word that is used too, and is more scale independent
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ competition is the word used by capitalist and anti-capitalist academics - voluntary too POV
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ competition may or may not occur, voluntary exchanges are a form of cooperation
You want the definition from www.m-w.com? You got it bucko, sorry it doesn't support your bias
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ 'Marxist' should be capitalized and wikified... though why bother, it'll be reverted anyway.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ noting that the "capitalism" that they refer to is not the same definition marxists refer to.
Rv to last version by myself - The article had already made clear that it was not the marxist definition before your edit, you are just trying to overload the text
Revert to RJII. it is not POV to let the reader know that anarcho-capitalists are not referring to the marxist definition of capitalism, otherwise it's going to be less clear what is being said.
Ha, what a horribly twisted way to go about inserting capitalist bias into the article
/* Modern anarchism */ removed POV and bad grammar
Was a loaded term before, is still surprisingly a loaded term now
partial revert to RJII version. (it's not that anarcho-capitalists have a special definition that refers to a "free market", but that that *is* the common definition. Even merriam-webster common.)
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ how about delete it then, because it's not in the sense of freedom from government interference. A free market means more than that.
Rv to last version by Max. Feel free to expand on description, because "free market" is a loaded term
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ back to the original statement. (because a "free market" doesn't only mean free from government)

number 3, go to the talk page
including the word coercive would lead to the need to define it in each case, exceptions are addressed already, but voluntary oppression is still opposed
anarchists who are against voluntary hierarchical structure are not anarchists, since they favor voluntary relations
